alerts.message:
...High wind watch in effect from Tuesday evening through
Wednesday afternoon above 3500 feet...

The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued
a high wind watch above 3500 feet...which is in effect from
Tuesday evening through Wednesday afternoon.

* Locations...elevations above 3500 feet in the southern North
 Carolina mountains.

* Hazards...damaging wind gusts.

* Timing...south to southeast winds will increase rapidly Tuesday
 evening...possibly becoming damaging Tuesday night into
 Wednesday morning. The winds will shift southwest then westerly
 through the day on Wednesday and gradually subside.

* Winds...south to southeast at 25 to 35 mph with gusts of 50 to
 60 mph possible at times.

* Impacts...strong to damaging winds may blow down trees and power
 lines. Travel will become hazardous on higher mountain roadways
 and in locations where winds are channeled between passes.

Precautionary/preparedness actions...

A high wind watch means there is the potential for a hazardous
high wind event. Sustained winds of at least 40 mph...or gusts of
58 mph or stronger may occur. Continue to monitor the latest
forecasts.



Gerapetritis
